I didn't show the "Fortran-only" case which was about 2x faster than the outer-loop in Python approach.
Next-gen SciPy/NumPy should be based on stuff like this.
How do we get there?

for those interested, here's what Andreas had to say about codepy: "i was recommending against ASTs for code generation. cgen/AST generation is overkill for most things but just right for really complicated stuff" -- Andreas Kloeckner
For code generation templates, what about using a parser to create the AST, and then doing template replacement on the AST.  This seems safer than using purely text-based templating.
